abstracts.cdata!:
The resettlement action plan (RAP) for
            the Wuchang - Guangzhou railway corridor capacity expansion
            is based on investigations of property damage, determination
            of project impacts, analysis of governing policies and
            regulations, and consultation with the affected population.
            The RAP provides mitigation measures for the affected
            population, fostering the chance of raising/restoring their
            standard of living. These measures stipulate that: 1) the
            agricultural population resettlement should be dependent on
            land compensation transfers, thus minimizing resettlement
            risks, allowing for irrigation improvements, soil
            amelioration, and a sustainable animal and crop production.
            Further, as a potential to alter the rural setup,
            consideration should be given to industrial development; 2)
            appropriate training should be provided as needed whenever
            job transfers are considered; 3) urban housing compensation
            standards are to be determined according to the
            reconstruction price; 4) enterprises' resettlement
            compensation is also to be determined according to the
            reconstruction price, with no depreciation value. The RAP
            encourages community participation and suggests the
            provision of grievance appeal mechanisms during displacement.
